abstract: Holland Cotter Critic's Notebook compares Smack Mellon exhibition Respond, which is made up of works on issues of racism, police violence and social justice, to traveling show The Left Front: Radical Art in the ‘Red Decade,’ 1929-1940, currently at New York University's Grey Art Gallery; works in both shows hew to consistent style and ideology.
lead_paragraph: The deaths of Eric Garner and Michael Brown sparked angry protests in the streets that are now immortalized in art.
